My friends and I got there at about 1030 with no expectation of food, but thought we'll have a drink and if appetizers were available we'd get something.    We did the responsible thing and called ahead, and were told kitchen is open and bar is open.  We arrived two or three minutes later to be told kitchen closed and they'd already made last call.    Now I can understand kitchen closed, it was 1035 if nobody had ordered food for a while that makes sense, but the bar closing an hour and a half early is ridiculous.  Especially when:  1. We were told 2 minutes before everything was open   2. There were people at the bar drinking   I get wanting to go home when it's slow, if that's the case, change the sign to say we close when ever.  Also don't tell someone one thing and do another that's just bad business.

Hy04jM_5_LMaHNnx50F0rg.text: No more 2.50 drafts. There are better options if paying full price for beer.  We won't be returning, I will just go across the street.

photos.caption: Photo of Kickstand Burgers & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Kickstand Burgers & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Kickstand Burgers & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

nPjf-tDZagA5hWXt3pZtpA.text: It has taken me too long to come back to my earlier review.  THANK YOU Kickstand!!! Our whole trivia team is so happy that you brought back wine specials on Wednesdays!!!  As I said before, Kickstand's Wednesday night staff is always wonderful. Rich, in particular, is always so kind and patient and we so appreciate the work that him and everyone else puts in to making trivia night so fun and enjoyable. Chris has always been awesome, going above and beyond getting to know us and making the whole Kickstand experience wonderful.

GTVUI3gJN3Oq0y7C31dtUQ.text: Finally got to stop in and check it out. Plenty of parking in the back. Inside is nicely done and feels cozy, I could definitely spend a few hours hanging out here. But on to the food!  They have many burger variations that sounded great, but I went for the traditional cheeseburger with chipotle mayonnaise and fries. It was awesome good!  Cooked just right, and the fries are those crispy kind that tasted so good!  They have wings and sandwiches and even gluten free bread available.  I'll be back and I'll bring my friends!

photos.caption: Photo of Kickstand Burgers & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Kickstand Burgers & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

woP6f00k4OGp551gnSEZYA.text: As a new resident to Charlotte I must say the food scene has been VERY disappointing. Perhaps my standards are a bit too high as South Florida is a culinary heaven, with a wide variety of foods.   After an unsuccessful attempt at a local Peruvian Food Festival which was horrific, we decided to try Kickstand for some burgers. Their reviews seemed good and you can't wrong with a burger (or can you)   It's located right off the road with plenty of off road parking in the back full of potholes and uneven terrain, but at least the parking is free. It's attached to a Mexican restaurant which was pretty unusual but cool nonetheless. Thinking back we probably should have chosen the Mexican restaurant.   We were greeted promptly and accommodated with our usual booth request and that's when it all went downhill. We sat there for 10-15 minutes before our server arrived to take our drink orders. He seemed flustered and overwhelmed, actually ALL of the servers appeared flustered which was confusing as they were NOT busy. I immediately began having second thoughts and had the urge to leave, but didn't!   After receiving our drinks we placed our orders and the server was very vague with his answers regarding food inquiries. I asked him several times about a particular food item and he assured me it only came with steak and cheese. I would find out 30 minutes later that he was wrong and came with unpleasant and unwanted sauce. The burger we ordered also arrived incorrectly! At this point we threw in the towel and decided to leave. How a place this unorganized can receive such good ratings seems very suspicious, but I experienced first hand that they are far from a 4 or 5 star rating.   Also the 6$ burgers don't even come with fries which is pretty lame. We've been to many burger spots that offer 5-6$ burgers on a weekly basis and include fries, of course not here in Charlotte.

ZlRsUj4ACjSB-6a9RC9OUg.text: Great private room to have Birthday Parties ! They have a great staff and she paid great attention to us . It was a 1st Birthday Party And  it worked out perfect ! Second time I have been there for a Birthday. Great Apps, Pickle Spears, Nachos, Onion Straws! They will substitute any kind of roll you want on the burgers . Big selection of Craft Beers and Ciders, I would recommend this place anytime !

kzLXCY-Mr5KYPMgUIJ_mMw.text: The fried pickles here are spears. SPEARS! And they are delicious.   I feel like Kickstand is one of those underrated spots you sometimes forget about. I've found myself here now twice in the last two weeks and both times said to myself, why don't we come here more?  Burger-wise, I haven't had a bad one. I'm a big fan of the signature kickstand. The shroom n swiss is usually a go-to item. I always get the Greek orzo salad. The nachos are a great app to share. They are huge and smothered in a queso-like cheese. Onion tanglers app is also a large portion. My friend got a cup of the chili during our last visit. She really liked it, it has garbanzo beans in it. They also have a shells and cheese section where you can build your own and add toppings.   They have a pretty good beer selection and a lot of local options. Different drink specials throughout the week, including $2 mimosas on Sundays. A lot of TVs. Nice spot to catch a game.   Note: the bathrooms are shared with La Unica. You have to walk out of Kickstand to get them. They are located in a small hallway between the restaurants.

photos.caption: Photo of Kickstand Burgers & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Trek burger
Photo of Kickstand Burgers & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried pickles
Photo of Kickstand Burgers & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Nachos

UkTMfa_WSN0xSrf_CSo0ew.text: Thoroughly mediocre. Here's another place where the menu online looks much better than the food actually is.   When you pull into the parking lot, you have to drive all over gravelly rocks. It's fun to reenact a scene from a post-apocalyptic sci-fi movie, but you might not like this as much if you've recently washed your car.   Anyway, it wasn't particularly crowded, but the service was slow. It took some time just to get water, let alone our bar drinks.   So we started with the pimento cheese fries. The fries had a weird texture kinda (I guess overly fried? kinda like bumpy), and the pimento cheese was okay. We had a small clump of chives banished to a corner, but no other chives anywhere. I will eat cheese fries forever, though, so I shamefully ate them all.   I had the Hungover Cyclist, which is a burger between two grilled cheeses. The grilled cheese part was disappointingly flat and greasy without being buttery. They didn't ask how we wanted our burgers, which really bothers me because I DESPISE a well-done burger. These were medium well, I guess, but that's like two settings higher than I like.   I did like my Bloody Mary a lot, and it was cheap. No salt on the rim, though.   So to recap, I didn't love this place and probably won't go back on purpose, but if someone else suggests it, I'm okay eating there.

photos.caption: Photo of Kickstand Burgers & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hungover Cyclist burger (burger between grilled cheeses).

k-nH86TNdfdFUQf54jnsNA.text: Great burger bar. Lots of meat (and non meat) options and ways to customize your burger.   I did the Quadricycle challenge (not on the menu), which basically has 5 different burgers in between grilled cheese sandwiches. You have 30 minutes to eat it and if you do, its free. I was only the second person in the recollection of the staff to have completed the challenge. I got to sample a variety of the offerings.  The veggie burger was on point. Zucchini, black beans, corn, all mixed in for a great texture and fried on the outside for a nice crunch. All the burgers were juicy and well-seasoned without being too salty. Condiments were all good as well, crispy bacon, creamy guacamole, melty cheese. Tuesday nights are unlimited toppings for $10. Give them a try.

Cn9DffPmU3ynujFOHziwaQ.text: I really wanted to like kickstand more than I actually did. I came here with high expectations  with them being in a great location and near some of the biggest burger competition. Started with fried pickles which were amazing and done just how I prefer them. But I ultimately came here for the burger. The meat seemed to be chewy, extremely over cooked and dry. The egg on my burger was cooked beyond over hard which and egg should never be on a burger unless upon request. Wait staff was extremely nice. Could have been just a bad night, so I'll definitely be back to try it again. Until next time kickstand.

Faln78jjgykB-HRmRyAT1w.text: Woooooooo!!!! That burger was GREAT! I mean the flavor was just... I don't know how to describe it... All the flavors of the Fender Bender just blend. Now... I did get mine without the mushrooms. Remember? I don't like woogly shit in my mouth. Perhaps it may have elevated the burger, but I'm sure it was just as good without. I could taste everything. The saltiness of the cheese, the spices from the chili, the mild yet subtle taste of the coleslaw and the simply seasoned meat. I like that the chili had chickpeas in it. Interesting.   The sweet tots were good. I wasn't really feeling the mildly flavored maple syrup? It didn't really add to the flavor of the sweet tots for me. Just wasn't hittin it. I settled on a mixture of mayo, mustard and ketchup to dip them in.   The shells and cheese were good the first bite. But then I took a second bite thinking, "this reminds me of something". Third bite, "I feel like I had this before". Fourth bite, "maaan this is like Velveeta box mac and cheese" Nothing wrong with it, it just didn't stand out.   Now I would have been satisfied if I could have gotten a coke float. I didn't need it but I wanted it.   Service started out great. One of the recommendations from our person was the Fender Bender, and I appreciate it. I really do. But then service was a bit mucky.   I told him I wanted the mac and cheese to try now but will take home. He asked me before he left if he could just put it in a to go container. I said that's cool. He comes back with it in a bag with the mac in a container talking about something like I put it in the container and didn't know if you cared but it's in there anyway so "that's what you're going to get"... not with an attitude or anything but I thought it was weird to say that.   Anyway fast forward to eating our food. Someone else checked on us which was cool. Then the guy checked on us which was cool, but this was all like maybe after I took a couple bites of my burger. Now I don't need someone coming to the table all the time, but all of a sudden I see checks on the table as I was getting through with my meal. Sooooo... I guess no dessert? He didn't ask if we needed anything else. Perhaps I should have put in my coke float when i was ordering everything else??? No float for Tieren... --- {insert sad face}  Also, the entire time I'm drinking an Arnold Palmer. I asked for a to-go cup for my drink. Normally at other restaurants they just give me a cup with a fresh drink in it. He doesn't. No biggie. However, when he put my drink in the to go cup I asked for a top off. He pours tea in there.... I wish you could see my face now.. Yea um I had an Arnold Palmer. Now it's just mostly tea.   Whatever. He seemed pretty rushed from the beginning to the end. I feel like there was a enough balance of him recommending the great burger I had to checking up on us once to a couple of the small things that I'll put a half star loss on him. The other half star was the concept of the sweet tots being just okay.   But I would definitely go back to try another burger.  Ps. My home said the mozzarella sticks looks cuter than they taste... just some average cheese sticks.

photos.caption: Photo of Kickstand Burgers & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mozzarella Sticks
Photo of Kickstand Burgers & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Fender and Bender
Photo of Kickstand Burgers & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mac and Cheese

iiTAYUiSwTt7ACd1fgSEfA.text: Nothing crazy or over the top, but it's definitely solid bar food.  I actually would have rated them 3.5 stars, if it was an option...  Started with the pimento cheese fries... plenty of cheese, but lacking some pimento.  I had the veggie sliders; good bean-based "burgers," with avocado and cheese, but the buns were trying to steal the show.  My friend had the chicken tenders, tossed in the hotter hot sauce.  The flavor was good and they stayed pretty crispy.  I believe she was a newer employee, but Shampayne provided great service to my friend and me!   She was very pleasant and attentive.  I've only been for lunch, and it was pretty quiet, so maybe the atmosphere is better/more exciting at night or on big game days..?  Either way, I feel like Kickstand has a lot of untapped potential and I want to like it more.  I would return because they have a decent menu and the service was good... but, realistically, how many other places near Central Ave also provide solid bar food and good service?  As of right now, I'm still sitting comfortably at 3.5 stars.

aTzyOpAfh8VCQ34vjSfluQ.text: This is a nice spot to stop by while in the Plaza area. This is currently the spot for GA Dawg fans so I'm here each Saturday. The staff is friendly and typically fast despite being slammed during these times. On Saturdays they offer $3 Terrapin beer which is great. They have several draft beers and also some canned. The parking lot is gravel in the back which isn't ideal but it's not terrible. You can find me here on Saturdays!

XcEjQO_Cnf-Gxe28pgDJKQ.text: Friday is Cheeseburger Friday and so I headed to Kickstand and ordered a beer with their eponymous "Kickstand Burger."  The beer was quick - they have 20 or 30 fresh ones on tap - and while my burger was being put together, I had a chance to look around the place. It's a sports bar with a dozen televisions and there are a couple of skill games lurking about. The patio looked comfortable, but probably not on a July day when the temp is coming up on triple digits. I sat inside.  My burger arrived, cooked to order (medium rare) and assembled as requested. The burger patty is mixed with sundried tomato and onions and garlic and then they cop it with cranberry chutney, caramelized and brie. The burger was flavorful but wow, the cheese on top was an excellent choice. Sweet and smoked, it was perfect with the meat.  Very good burger, nice place. I could see returning.

photos.caption: Photo of Kickstand Burgers & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Kickstand Burger with LTO and slaw
Photo of Kickstand Burgers & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Front of Kickstand Burgers
Photo of Kickstand Burgers & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. The bar at Kickstand

wFIW32rLYSrslyMwUecQSg.text: Fast service, friendly staff. We got the Kickstand Burger and The Fender Bender. Both were delicous! Also tried the burger with the guac and pico but forgot the name and it was great too!

3AGR9koqqFcwbTxQteWpXA.text: What a great night! My friends and I were looking for a place to watch the Panthers game yesterday but wanted good service and not to be crammed into a bar with a bunch of 21 year old people (no offense). We found it. Josh, the general manager, had a room specifically designated for Panthers fans. It was perfect. The food was great and the service was top notch! Several of the people in my group were from out of town and had wanted to see several different bars. Not after we got to Kickstand. Everyone agreed this was the place to stay and we had a blast. Nice to be in a neighborhood establishment with friendly people, no loud music, and plenty of TV's. I'll be back soon and often.

dd77EE651-qxsWDkp-O46Q.text: I'm updating this review and rating for a couple of reasons.    1) I've eaten/drank my worries away here a dozen times or so and I've never had a bad experience.  2)The food is always cooked exactly as I expect whether it's 2pm for lunch or 9.30pm for a late (Late for the US) dinner.  3)Beer knowledge.  When my wife couldn't see the tap handles from our booth she asked our server to just pick one for her, he proceeded to ask what type of beer she was in the mood for and then made an excellent selection.  4)Atmosphere.  This place has been consistently busy, with tvs every where (good when important sporting events are going on, otherwise generally distracting), and is always clean.  How good is it?  My cravings for "Mexican" food pop up about 4x's a day and I've never been to the restaurant attached to Kickstand because if I'm driving over there, I'm grabbin a morning ride.

4ont1_CHjoPXScSrCkdG6A.text: I live in Philadelphia but frequent Charlotte at least once a month. This bar is great! THEY HAVE THE BEST NACHOS. I went here to watch a football game and had a great day. Great food, good beer, and TVs. I highly recommend.

6_17mSkC8rn3gxBITxHbqA.text: Ordered the Schroomin n Swiss with coleslaw. Burger was juicy and hot off the grill. I would skip the coleslaw and the tots were typical frozen tots. Great burgers with mediocre sides.

NjhswfaszYFnZhBau03KRA.text: I threw my boyfriends surprise 21st bday party here. Matt and everyone I worked with at Kickstand were absolutely phenomenal. They are the nicest people. They were so willing to go above and beyond to make sure everything went smoothly. And the food was delicious! It was the perfect place to celebrate his birthday. I can't think Kickstand enough.

q12Q5WvLqSuznovL6yXj_w.text: Kickstand is a fun joint. I've been a couple times for dinner, and for an event recently. The staff is friendly and very welcoming, and all the biking decor certainly sets it apart from other QC eateries.  They have a decent enough selection of beer, nothing out of this world, but better than most. I think the same can be said of the food offerings. Their burgers are decent, though I've had a range of qualities in my visits - consistency takes time, and they are working on it. Their signature burger, dressed with brie and cranberry sauce, is a different take on things that I enjoyed. The fact that you can get sweet potato tots is a nice addition, too.  I will say, though, that the parking situation is abysmal. You can't navigate the gravel lot, once down a row you're only exit is to put it in reverse and hope no one is trying to enter, and those raised embankments make even SUVs run aground. Come on guys...  Neat place, neat area, and with a few glitches worked out, could stand to be a long-lasting spot.

DEIznFXTkTSImokUxU60HA.text: I finally made it to this burger joint and I must say I was impressed. Cool decor, an abundance of tv's, and they also have games. I went to watch the Hornets and drink a couple beers but I ended ordering some wings as well and I must say they really impressed. I will definitely be returning to try the rest of the menu. The beer selection was solid, the wings are great, and the bartender was awesome.

cDrvQoa8tzTQ35Cpg5QixQ.text: Kickstand Burgers & Bar is a nice place to just chill out with  your friends.  Loved the environment!  When  you first walk in through the front door and see sight of the skeeball machine, don't get distracted and forget to turn right.  The building is connecting two restaurants, and if you turn left, you'll end up going into another restaurant!  Just thought I'd put it out there.  Anyways, when I walked in, I thought the place inside looked very nice and chill.  I liked how they had an old looking bike set up in the corner of the restaurant, and there was an old tricycle set up in another part of the restaurant.  Some booths that I passed by were wicked cool, and let me tell you why.  For the booths I saw, there was a small TV in each booth!  How great if you're watching a game so you won't have to arch your neck or squint your eyes to see what's going on.  Kudos to that.  But I did not sit inside.  My group decided to sit outside since it was nice out.  The scenery there was not too shabby at all.  There were even ceiling fans out so we weren't sweating too much.  Our server was great the whole time.  Great service!  He was always checking up on us making sure we were happy and had everything that we needed.  Friendly service always helps with the atmosphere.  The food was amazeballs.  For an appetizer, we ordered the Pimento Cheese Fries and they were so delicious!  I had to make sure to check myself and not take more than my share.  Good thing it was on the other side of the table or I would've killed that plate by myself!  My friend and I decided to split an order of wings, and what a good choice we made.  The wings were delicious with the Garlic Parmesan sauce dabbled over the wings.  It wasn't an overwhelming taste at all.  Just right.  For my burger, I chose The Cuban and my friends decided to make their own burgers.  I might have to try that one day for a fun experiment.  My burger was delicious though, no complaints other than it was just so HUGE.  It's definitely worth your money to try out food here because they give you a good amount.  I was totally stuffed with amazing food in a chill environment.  Everyone who is looking for a burger joint to just eat good food and have a great time with friends needs to check this place out for sure.

8q3sy-ZDurqrRtnGk70JiQ.text: Now I know why they are on every top burger list in Charlotte.  You have to try the signature burger The Kickstand.  Perfect combination of sweet and savory. I will be back to try the other specialty burgers.  The service was great as well. I would recommend reservations.

XNSbBHVB-NhQfUfyg0XIPw.text: This place is tremendous, an excellent option for a burger when stopping through this area of Charlotte. I had wanted to go here for a while before my roommate and I actually went. It was a Sunday, the night of the Golden Globes, though we were treated to 60 Minutes on our table-exclusive television. That was a nice touch. Not many people were in the restaurant, which was a good way to spend a quiet evening. The wait staff is very nice and helpful. I had a salad as a side, and it was very good. My roommate got National Bohemian beer to go with his burger, but I just got water. I had a Fender Bender, and it was positively enormous. It took a Herculean effort to finish, although not having eaten all day helped. I highly recommend going here if you get the chance. It is perhaps a little pricier than some of the other places around, like the Diamond, but when you see the portion, you understand why.

photos.caption: Photo of Kickstand Burgers & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fender Bender with side salad

siEsx1HhxZmrOEbneHAuZw.text: The CLT CM brought me here to ease my hunger, 10pm on a weeknight. It's a bike bar -- but not those kinds of bikes. Cruisers serve as decor. Good-looking beer list, with some locals featured -- though sadly, they were out of the brew I wanted. Ended up with the Olde Meck Copper... an interesting beer.  For food, I wolfed down the namesake Kickstand Burger. With caramelized onions, brie, and a cranberry sauce. Yum! Fries are unsalted, and have a crusty texture. But you can order tots instead, and the tots are tops!

DDr1QsxcezVR30GE1gc97w.text: What's to say? I mean another classic example of overloaded wait staff on a football Sunday afternoon.  Staff up people!  The experience started out fine but ended horribly with us waiting for nearly 15-20 minutes just to cash out.  In between the beginning and end of our stay we were bombarded with nearly warm beer and ghost like service.  Oh well, I had high hopes and I'll probably give it another shot in time when the place isn't as crowded.    PS.  If you are a Redskins fan, this is your place!  They have a whole room dedicted to you.

UpMTavH33xUmrQClx3Ckcw.text: Although they advertise they have gluten free options, last 2 times I have been here,  "they ran out yesterday. "

MYJ7YhiyZssOLub6senRNA.text: Food was awesome. That was the only good thing. Service was horrible. Ordered wings, never came, he said he forgot to put them in. The manager came over with a gift card to cover wings for our next visit. But then, brought food... No utensils. Drinks took 5-7 minutes to receive any refills or new beers. He would come around every 20 min and not even make eye contact. We had to put our and in the air for service. Sat with an empty beer for ages. I wanted to get something to go but decided against it for the sake of making it home tonight. Won't be back anytime soon.

YPz0TnZLrqQ-jH9Vadz5cg.text: Ordered 12 chicken wings and fries  for pick up.  Upon arriving at home, there were only 8 wings.  Called in and server was apologetic for placing wrong order.  Manager offered to make another 4 wings and for us to drive back to pick it up again, duuuuuh... Why would I drive all the way back for 4 wings???  I requested delivery or credit for next purchase.    Although food was good, especially the fries, the manager was rude, unprofessional and confrontational.  When asking how he can compensate, I said he need to start by changing his tone when speaking to customer.  We all have bad day once in a while, but know your place when working in customer facing business.  Manager said he would credit back in 48 hours.  I would rate food as a 4, customer service however is poor at best.

0fW_mq-Tc3C6eHHnMos5tw.text: If you are in the Plaza-Midwood area and are craving a burger or chicken sandwich, then this is the spot! I have been here three times over the past few months and I have never been close to disappointed. The burgers are wonderfully delicious and the options are endless. I have also had the buffalo chicken sandwich which I would recommend. We ordered the friend onions as an appetizer and the portion was HUGE! They also have a great beer selection. Finally, you must try the fried pickles!!! They are divine.

UWVFuK-Y0YeJUX-i-kB1mw.text: A great place for a night out.  Didn't get a chance to try a burger, but I did try some of their buffalo wings and chicken wings.  Well worth it.

8LOofd999ZwAcIi3f8SAFg.text: The chipotle wings are great And I had them delivered right to my door with Postmates still hot and fresh when arrived I will be going there very soon to check out the bar and burgers and more wings of course  try Postmates if in Charlotte here is a free delivery code for a your first try rechellej

LDVzhUrUiOR7xmS8BLfF2Q.text: Best gluten free burger buns in town! Staff is so friendly and attentive. The burgers are so good that I haven't even tried any of the other menu items.

afnQsAf1xnEj7ULawxTGNA.text: Great! And quick service! They have specialty burgers and BYO! Had the Fender Bender and a BYO both were great and cooked just how we liked them (one medium and one med well). Mimosas on Sunday here are only $2 and almost a full wine glass. Your welcome :)

photos.caption: Photo of Kickstand Burgers & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

P6tzJ5qcVmww9cw710KKCw.text: I don't give high reviews very often, but I really enjoy the food, service and atmosphere of this resturant. I've always been greeted promptly and the wait staff are friendly and helpful. The food is consistently good (I recommend the tenders rolled in teriyaki, half the price of similar resturants) and extremely well priced. Perhaps what I like most is the unassuming, relaxed atmosphere.

Z10f8W3IqqgYJwEr0e0fgQ.text: My fiance and I absolutely love this place. Burgers are some of the best in Charlotte. Do yourself a favor and try a different one every time. Ample parking and seating so no driving around in Plaza Midwood for ten minutes trying to park and then having to wait for a table. The service is always great as well as the beer selection. Craft beer from throughout NC. Also get the sweet potato tots. You're welcome.

NBE-9uHm39lQqyCIM6OdUw.text: Love this place! We've actually only eaten inside the restaurant once, and have ordered take out several times.  Something I've learned over the years: if a restaurant can serve amazing take-out, they're worth going back to!  The wings here are pretty solid, and my husband swears by the sweet potato tots with maple syrup dipping sauce.  I've ordered several different combo burgers here, as well as a few original 'make your own', and they were all solid!! Not too greasy, great quality of meat, perfect preparation, and top notch ingredients.  If you're in the mood for good burgers + fries food that will please everyone, this is the place!

DrTeFqQnCOgYrjOksZmTMQ.text: For the last sixteen weeks, I've enjoyed the food and the service at The Kickstand.  They so graciously hosted our Redskins fan group every Sunday during the season and as the it turned out, finding this place was the best part of the football season.    There's more tv's in this place than one can imagine including booth tv's near the bar.  The bar is awesome too.  For a trendy restaurant in Plaza Midwood, the beer is cold and cheap - a huge plus and a rare find.    For a burger place, you might not expect the wings to be a main attraction however the Spicy Tiger wings are clearly off the hook and fried pickle fans: by far the best in town.  Most places fried pickles are the dill chips while these guys fry up the spears for more pickle-y goodness.    The burger menu is something put together by a mad-burger-scientist.  The Hangover is two grilled cheese sandwiches with a tomato and a burger in between.  Not just a cheese burger with toast but 2 grilled cheese sandwiches!  That's insanity...and so good.  They have everything you can imagine and you can tell it's all fresh.    Salads are pretty good too.  They use real lettuce (not the iceberg junk) and fresh vegetables - not something else you'd find at a burger joint.  Usually the salad is a complete after thought and the last thing you'd order.    Overall, this place rocks!  Service is great. Food is great! What more can you ask for?

photos.caption: Photo of Kickstand Burgers & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Kickstand Burgers & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Redskins Room
Photo of Kickstand Burgers & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. That&#39;s a burger between two grilled cheese sandwiches

GCzkAM-my8m_dIpCC3hWrA.text: Me and my wife have been here numerous times and it's always pretty good food with solid service. If you're in the mood for a burger with a lot of different options to choose from this place should be on the top of your list.  Nothing complicated here, it's a burger joint and they do it right!

0ATxQUXBr5y_hXBMFn9kNA.text: Burgers are ultra dope. Service was bad, once. Every other time has been great. $10 build your burger with $3.50 drafts on Tuesdays. Why is this place empty? Can y'all come back here so I can keep having cheap beer and burgers?

C5WariPy1OGYyZZDE05bXA.text: After watching an episode of How I Met Your Mother about searching for the perfect burger, my friends and I suddenly had a mad hankering for a burger.  We headed down to Kickstand tonight in order to sate our cravings.  This is not my first trip here, but I've yet to review this place.  I simply love this place; they have some tasty burgers and appetizers.  Let me tell you about some of the great things here.  On our first night here, we ordered the nachos as an appetizer.  Imagine a gigantic platter, completely filled with chips, and piled high with cheese, jalapenos, chili, beans, and the usual nacho condiments.  Truly, two people could eat this as a meal, and probably four people could eat this an an appetizer.  The chili on it is not too hot and not too sweet, with a solid flavor.  We love these things, and have ordered them more than once now.  The first burger we tried was the Fender Bender, with chili, fried onions, mushrooms, and even bacon.  It was good, but more of a knife-and-fork kind of burger.  We had their tater tots, which are pretty tasty as well.  We had tried Le Trek burger (grilled onions, blue cheese, steak sauce & chipotle mayo) with bacon added - which is definitely their best burger.  My partner has also had the Kickstand burger, which was a little disappointing (the cranberry chutney and brie are just weird on a burger).  You can also build your own burger, as well as choose from veggie and turkey burgers, other sandwiches, plus hotdogs.  I am told the vegetarian burger is awesome with beef instead of the veggie patty itself.  Their sweet potato tater tots are ok too.  Not to mention they have some decent beer specials, including $1 PBRs every night.  Service has been pretty good each time we've been here, and each time it's been on a busy weekend night.  My biggest complaint is that the parking situation is a pain.  There are no lines in the parking lot, and people just park wherever, making it difficult to navigate the lot.    This is a decent place to grab a burger and a beer while watching a game.

5jts9fwThOmS21BfTZ0Mpg.text: Great food and service every time I've visited.  Their burgers, flatbread pizzas, onion tanglers, and chili are my favorites.  Their bar selection could use some improvement, I've ordered fairly standard drinks, and on several occasions have been told they don't have the right ingredients.  They have a lot of TVs often showing sports, but they keep the volume low, and I've never been in there with a hooting and hollering vibe going on.  That may just be because of the days and times I've gone.  Once, I was in there when they were doing a trivia contest where the host was set up close to our table with an overpoweringly loud speaker.  We left pretty much immediately.  Other than that, a good dining experience.

wyV0EY3PXWKObI3j_whMEg.text: Had the blue cheese burger salad. It was wonderful. Everyone aft our table loved their meal. Had some special needs on one plate and our server made sure it was perfect. We will be back!

Gllf3SbyWDTTQ01NVpuWsA.text: We come here every Monday for $3 Charlotte beer and the burgers are the best in town! Sean/Shawn and Kenny are the best!

Kx2nOAHkgZcRzYug_jOKcw.text: I kept hearing about the great burgers here and I finally decided to see for myself. So glad I did!   Started with pimento cheese fries, which were amazing. They came with a couple of jalapeno slices, which added a nice kick but I wish there had been a few more slices. The cheese was amazing and perfectly melted, and the ranch dressing was perfect.   The booty burger was delicious. I ordered mine with a beef patty rather than turkey. It was perfectly cooked (medium) and the only problem was I'd filled up on cheese fries so I couldn't eat it all!  The shells and cheese was good, not great. A little too rich but without real cheese flavor. I had Gorgonzola mixed in, which helped. I ate a couple of bites and put the rest in a to-go box. Still good enough that I will eat it later!  Ambience was great. Casual, great place to hang out and have a beer. Service was really good. I can't wait to go back.

paYQlx5xxvoh3I6WdM7Ruw.text: Big fan of build your own burger.  I feel this place gets lost in the shuffle of the Plaza Midwood area. It really shouldn't because their food and beer selection is really good.   Like I opened with their build your own burger section is my favorite part of the menu. I'm constantly on and off a strict diet and that part of the menu caters to my needs. And when I'm off my diet the sweet tots are a must.  They always have a couple dozen craft beers on tap. Mostly local. Yay!  My girlfriend and I go about every Sunday and just about every time we are there the manager stops by to check on us. Which is a very nice personal touch that keeps us coming back.

ILWuFcxZBDdHhvmAnnEUVw.text: "The Running Machine"... (which i always want to call "the running man", because why not?) ... is perfect. Not all that big a fan of turkey burgers normally but this one is so good that 9 times out of 10, I'll get it instead of something else.   I love Kickstand in general. Great staff, great beers, great atmosphere- super willing to work with you when you want to bring in a group (I think I actually come here more for group events than dates with my husband).   This is one of Charlotte's best places to be.   Our waiter went and won a stuffed frog from a carnival machine out in the front and gave it to my daughter just because. That's beyond good service.   Excellent food, excellent people.

UhtSc-5IIkQAAl0bFhdZfg.text: My hubby and I had to try Kickstand after passing them numerous times on Central Ave. We are big fans of burgers and wanted to see if they should be added to our list of favorite burger joints.   Kickstand has a neat name and a really cool atmosphere. The music also rocks - they were playing classic rock the night we were there. The service is also very attentive. But the big downer for me was that the food was just ok.    I'm disappointed that I cannot get a medium rare burger in NC. So, I cannot really hold that against Kickstand. But, I was given a choice of how my burger was prepared (medium), and it was pretty much overcooked and not juicy in the least. I also love mac 'n cheese and was excited that this was a side option with my burger, but I just didn't like their version.  I might give them another try, but probably not. The addition of Bad Daddy's to Birkdale will make them my primary go-to place for burgers. Sorry, Kickstand!

W682N7v6HqR6ke2PWwdCSA.text: Good burgers. Live the tangled fries and tarot tots. Great service and atmosphere. Fun and a large beer selection. Good Saturday lunch stop!

nMLETcq1BjOvXzyJMR8ayA.text: These guys need to get their Sunday gameday act together. They used to be such a great bar that showed EVERY game. Not anymore. It's always been our go-to on Sunday's because we could watch every team there. The majority of the TV's now have Redskins on. There's a separate Redskins room for those diehard fans. And their game is on full sound. The rest of us would like to see our games on in the bar area too. In the past, a different game was on EVERY TV. I wont be coming back if this is how they show their so called diversity for everyone's team. The manager didn't have a clue as to how to set up the TV's BEFORE 1:00 when the games started. It was after 1:00 & he still didn't know what was going on or how organized & fair it had been every other season. There used to be post-it's labeled for each game on each TV. This guy had the Skins on 7 out of the 10 bar TV's. I realize it's supposed to be a Skins bar, but come on, you have to also show all the other games too.  For a sports bar, we're very disappointed this season & might have to find a new place that will fairly show all games.   The AC must not have been working because it was literally about 90 degrees inside. Everyone was complaining. There were not enough servers & bartenders to handle the packed crowd, which ended up being standing room only around 1:00. In the 3 hours we were there, a server came around 3 times. That's unacceptable. I waited almost an hour for her to get me another drink & then she didn't even stop by to check on us. We had to walk up to the bar & get our own drinks. I'm hoping this is just first game day of the season jitters & they will get it together for the rest of the season. We typically really love this place, so this was all highly unusual.

photos.caption: Photo of Kickstand Burgers & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

O26TRxNdiUdYfoS4UZIADQ.text: Best burger in Charlotte, hands down.  Awesomeness, for sure.  The salads are also pretty fresh, green and amazing.  Staff is pretty great, however some of the newer wait staff have a bit of a 'tude.  Nonetheless, it's my favorite spot in my plaza midwood hood.   Oh, and there's beer.  Local stuff.  Good stuff.

3a3EF0Bv6X0n0i42GeQizg.text: Recently kickstand has become our hotspot on wednesday for pub trivia. This place is awesome. If you are coming for trivia, I would try to arrive no later than 745. This gives you time to get situated and order your food/drinks. Our server is awesome.  We have had the same now for two weeks.  Hopefully she sticks with us (good luck charm).    I would bring a big group of friends and just have a relaxing Wednesday.

uFw0FK3MtadqJ7SMojdhwA.text: Best veggie burger in Charlotte - hands. down.  I hear the other burgers are great as well from my meat-eating friends.  The atmosphere is cozy, the servers are always friendly and the food as consistently yummy every time we eat here.  Try it for yourself - you won't be disappointed!

I1q5sBU2XpjdDPrmTJgcDQ.text: Kickstand Burgers and Bar offers one of THE best tasting veggie burgers in Charlotte. It tastes of fresh black beans and seasoning, plus whatever they put on the burger is delicious too. I eat here quite often as I work right next door and cannot get over the black bean burger. They are a little pricey but completely worth the price if you ask me.

PqawcDUd1sTrOu0LLPZIPA.text: I heard such great things about kickstand and was really excited to go here, but was extremely let down when I came for trivia. The restaurant was about half full, my friend and I ordered wine, the bottle came but it took another 20 minutes to get glasses to drink it. We only got glasses because my friend went up to the bar (apparently they were out of wine glasses).    When we finally were able to order food they delivered it to the wrong table. My other friend ordered a beer and never received it. Our waiter came and delivered the check before mentioning or bringing his beer.   Huge let down....I'll head back to pint central for trivia night.

lHENwPTBTCs3ZLMNMwlwLQ.text: Came here for the first time on game day because we were craving wings. Kickstand did not disappoint! We arrived around half time and the service was good for how crowded it was. The wings were delicious and there were plenty of TV's to watch the game!

yQDPpE63iD_tOumuSo_1kw.text: Kickstand is one of Charlotte's burger joints and their signature burger is an amazing triumph is burger creation. The Kickstand Burger has sundried tomato, basil, garlic, cranberry chutney, carmelized onions, and baked brie. Somewhere between the sun-dried tomato and the baked brie your eyes start fluttering as you enter burger nirvana and the cranberry chutney makes this one of the Best Burgers in Charlotte.

photos.caption: Photo of Kickstand Burgers & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

8KfAQM4dHK1-jFsTQ_u8lw.text: Not a good experience at all.  My first, last, and only trip to Kickstand Burgers & Bar was a few weeks ago on a Saturday afternoon.  The experience was not good at all.  First, even though the location was sparsely populated it took quite a few minutes to be seated.  Apparently their focus is much more on the bar than the food (more on this later).  As there was no hurry to seat you if you were not sitting at the bar.  Further, the location was extremely loud for a Saturday afternoon as all the televisions were turned up like they were trying to capture the attention of the late night club crowd.  Anyway...the food was less than impressive.  I am a tomato sauce, cheese, and meat guy by nature so I love pizza and burgers.  From the menu here I ordered several items:  Fried Mozzarella The Hungover Cyclist (with fries) The Roni (with tater tots)  The fried mozzarella was awful.  It tasted like some frozen Farm Rich cheese sticks from the Walmart freezer section that still had freezer burn.  The marinara dipping sauce wasn't any better as it was nothing more than watery vinegar.  The Hungover Cyclist was just as awful as the fried mozzarella.  The grilled cheese sandwich was NOT a grilled cheese but rather a TOASTED CHEESE.  The bread was dry and hard and had clearly not been cooked in a pan.  You could also clearly tell that there was no butter on the bread and they did the most underwhelming thing possible...made a grilled cheese with just American cheese.  That being said...when you got to the burger...you had basically a large McDonald's burger with no seasoning to the meat.  Not good.  Finally...The Roni was the burger of the week.  This was supposed to be a "beer can" burger..filled with tomato sauce and mozzarella cheese (the delight of a tomato sauce, cheese, and meat guy).  Perhaps I disappointed readers earlier by revealing the fate of this visit but The Roni was another in the long line of failures here.  I am not sure which "beer can" they used but I would assume it was more a Red Bull Can as the burger was tiny.  Once again, the flavor was lacking (most likely due to the tiny burger and the inability to actual stuff anything into the "Red Bull Can" burger).  Simply put...one would come out better driving to Troutman, NC or Salisbury, NC and going to the nearest Sheetz and getting The Big Mozz burger.  Not only would you get a much larger and better burger at a better price...but the burger would have 3 fried cheese sticks on top of it that are FRESH and not from the Walmart freezer with freezer burn still on them.  In closing, the fries and tater tots were nothing special.  Again, these clearly came out of a pre-prepared pre-packaged collection of freezer items.  They tasted like...and were about as fresh as Gorton's fish sticks.     Save your time and your money.  If you want a bar atmosphere there are much better places.  If you want a good burger at a great price...go to Chubz Famous Chiliburgers (Woodlawn & I77).  If you want a varied menu and something similar to The Roni (only much better and more cost effective)...go to Sheetz.  Yeah...I said it...gas station food dwarfs anything on the Kickstand Burger menu.

BwU0NNJ5WYIVFmdIDgby0g.text: Food and service are good. Great staff. Restrooms however are consistently dirty- from the floors to the ceilings and walls- and everything in between.

fs-o-u0247g8vxDUzn-2yA.text: We sat at the bar and the bartender was very attentive, great bar food with some healthier options, and a nice selection of beers both local and seasonal.   They also participate in Service Industry Night on Mondays and give a discount!

tiAxRcCy4v8DVfsFxG_fUw.text: Went back. Again, 5 star. The salad with a burger on top was on-point. The kids were super happy and my wife's salad was also really good. Service was tight and the overall experience was excellent. Keep up the good work Kickstand!

SEVM_nsKBSICGUYa0aUdrg.text: Painter Smurf and I dropped in for dessert since they have updated the menu since the Redskins season last year. The BROWNIE A LA MODE is the best, a very soft, moist, warm gooey brownie, served with vanilla ice cream swizzled with chocolate syrup. It is worth every penny. I've even been just for the brownie alone.  The fried pickles are good as well, since they are cut in spears and breaded with a seasoned bread, great starter to any meal.  The spicy tiger wings are the best, with a sweet and hot flavor. #HTTR and Painter Smurf's home bar when he's in Charlotte.

photos.caption: Photo of Kickstand Burgers & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Painter and Jokey Smurf are really enjoying the new dessert item from the Kickstand.... ummmmm CHOCOLATE!!

ESvOpzSIXwBOV4LRzHenJw.text: My beer was served warm (and not in a cool, on-purpose way), and the burger was just okay. Fries were room temperature, limp, and soggy. Bill was $20 (with tip) for a burger, fries, and one beer--pretty steep, especially considering the quality. Our server was nice enough.

sHR7COV5oirwNG8Bk0I0hw.text: All I can say is Mmmm...mmmm...GOOD!  Never disappointed with a burger from this joint!  I always create something different.  Cooked fresh to order.    Looking for a substantial burger with no fuss....this is your place.    Try their Orzo Pasta Salad too....its delish!  Great drink specials. ... cool bar atmosphere.... lots of TVs.

55-xMmddeDBcSpp-W_SxEQ.text: I come here every Wednesday and they have the best burgers I've ever had.  Not only do they have amazing food but they're wait staff and management are the best in the business.  We come for trivia and the manager is super friendly and always fills in when they are short staffed. My favorite burger joint in CLT!

a88jDcSUjVQMFXhl58nEdA.text: I can't say enough great things about this place! I was looking for a last minute casual location with a room for birthday party.  Chris, the manager and Carrie, our server could not have been more helpful, accommodating, and gracious in helping us pull off the BD surprise! And then we got to eat!!! With a large group, we ordered many different things off the menu and each thing was better than the next.  The burgers especially, were truly "crafted" and just delicious.  Will definitely be back.

e8FMOpHQc_r8DYKiKhuDmA.text: Was craving a burger for Father's Day lunch so I yelped best burger places in Charlotte,  and this placed showed up near the top of the list.  Let me just say that after my meal I can think of at least 4-5 places in Charlotte where I've had a better burger recently.  IMO this place is not in the running.  The visit started with inattentive service- just because you are a casual place doesn't mean the service should be sloppy- Good service is good service regardless of the atmosphere.  Forgetting items,  not checking in,  lack of personality are the hallmark of a place with poor FOH management.    Secondly the menu has s selection of what I would call burgers with dubious combinations of flavors-  a turkey burger with avocado and pimento cheese?  C'mon...  Finally we ordered the fried mozzarella app-  we were served pre-made mozz sticks and canned sauce.  If your chef is so lazy that he won't cut and bread mozz and put together a simple fresh marinara,  well good luck to that establishment.

mBUmPiZb8zw0kB_thB156w.text: Planned and hosted many an event here. Must say that this is our go-to spot in Plaza. You really can't go wrong with $1 PBR every night of the week. (Hipsters UNITE!)  The staff has always been so kind and willing to get to know us as regulars. Derek, Justin, Telley, Jenny, Sunny and Jessica are always smiling and busting to make sure everything is running shipshape.   My wife and I had our rehearsal dinner here and Bryson did an amazing job serving our group of close to 50 people. One server, one room. He conquered it.   I've had my last two birthday parties here. Flawless as well. The private dining room is awesome. You can shut the doors and make it more intimate for your group. Great option.   Been to many a catered event here as well. They have a great system down.   The Food: You can't really find a burger on the menu that you won't like. (I recommend the cuban, running machine or the pocket press) Recently tried the sliders and they are rockin'.   Wings are awesome. Head over on Wednesdays for $.50 wings. Great flavors. Especially crazy about Barbalo (Buffalo/BBQ)  Definitely one of our staples in the QC. Can't believe I'm just now writing this review.

cuQ1HzMRbk_mVc1WF9KfiQ.text: Had a horrible experience at this establishment.  All of orders were incorrect and it took us along time for our orders to be taken. The waiter was not very suggestive. The best part of our visit was the hostess. She was very attentive and took of us when we needed something. I only suggest this place if you wanna sit at the bar for a drink and food.

zMupPQYOuz3t-qrnjtkA9Q.text: Visited Kickstand a couple weeks ago when we were in Charlotte for the day. We were in for lunch during the week. There was a good crowd but the service was prompt and our server, Mallory, was very friendly. The food was great really fresh and tasty. We started with the house made potato chips with chipotle ranch. It was a huge portion and they were delicious. I wish I had some right now. Overall, I would definitely visit again the next time I am in Charlotte.

pNavnl55Ck4BsO9NN7PSmw.text: Some friends and I ended up at kickstand on a friday evening mostly out of convenience because the wait for a table was 45+ every where else in the area. At kickstand 7 of us were seated immediately.   Good unique menu with lots of options for burger toppings and sides. Portion sizes are good, prices reasonable. Really good sweet potato tots. Burger was very good, but not the best in the area. Beer menu was pretty large but they were out of at 2-3 things on tap. Good place to park, which is great considering the area.

lSBOMJya5WBLjDYlujxD0w.text: Having lunch with my oldest son. Great food and great service. Have a great day and be safe my friends.

GR8LEFIKEvfyeDycRLLtIA.text: Wow is all I can say about the burgers. This is a great place to get some grub and brews while hanging out with friends.

x2XUGqyk_8rkfee-8ExGaQ.text: Had a lovely dinner at Kickstand on Tuesday.  Not too busy that night and the service was splended.  Hambugers yummy especially the veggie Trek with the infused steak sauce is ridiculous stupid. Enjoyed the beer special and the comfortable seating.  Not a sport night, but looks like a splended place to watch the big game.

J_WXMJHU43t9aHwb7MrCLA.text: My husband and I were very excited when the manager at Locolime told us about the new concept going in next door.  Locolime is one of our favorite places to eat and we go there probably once a week, we are also huge fans of Hawthorne's Pizza - so we were excited that the owners had a new concept with great drink specials.  My friends and I decided to give this place a try Friday night.  Unfortunately, that was a bad choice.  My food, the hung-over cyclist, was good but our experience will not make me return.  First, it started when our server gave us the drink specials, after everyone at our table ordered the special she came back and told us they were out of the special.  Then, we ordered the draft special, 3 out of the 4 beers were flat.  Not a great start but still we understood the place is new and has kinks to work out.  Next we order our food, my friend who has been a vegetarian her entire life (30 years) decided to get the original veggie burger with a salad and the dressing on the side (which we were informed is how all their salads come).  I guess that isn't the case though, the salad came and had the dressing already on it.  Then, the rest of our food comes and my friend takes a bite of her burger and she has a beef burger.  Okay, so the kitchen makes a huge mistake (shouldn't you have flags for veggie burgers so your servers know the difference?) but what made the entire situation worse was how the managers handled it.  First, they said "oh we will bring you out a new burger right away - the guy over there got your veggie burger and you got his sorry about that."  (I don't know how many vegetarians you know who would be okay with eating meat but I was very upset and it wasn't even me - my friend was in tears).  Next, the other manager comes over and says I am sorry, I used to be a vegetarian (key words USED TO) so I know how that is, we just opened and are still trying to get things worked out so we messed up.  But so you know for future reference the veggie burger comes with a wheat bun.  (really?!  You are now blaming the customer for your mistake).  Then, our server comes over and says "I am so sorry I used to be a pescetarian so I know how you feel."  (Again, key words USED TO).  All in all, the experience was not a pleasant one for anyone at the table and the only thing that was done was an apology and I will take your burger off.  If I were the manager I would have handled the situation completely different - it would have been one thing if I had ordered the hung-over cyclist and then was given the veggie burger or the pocket press but when you give someone who has never had meat in their life a beef burger and just say sorry I will take care of that - it doesn't cut it especially if you just opened.  Sadly, for this place I will not be going back and all of my friends who I had told about the place before we went now will not even be trying this place.
